**Government Tender Announcement**

**Title (English):** Aerological Observations at the Whitehorse Upper Air Station, Yukon Territory

**Amendment Date:** 2024-02-27

**Expected Contract End Date:** 2026-03-31

**Contracting Entity:** Environment and Climate Change Canada

**UNSPSC Classification:** 81151502 - Meteorological Services

## Details
Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) invites proposals for aerological observations at the Whitehorse Upper Air Station, Yukon Territory, as outlined in the Statement of Work (Annex A). The contract period is expected to run from contract award to March 31, 2026, with optional renewal periods of three (3) one-year intervals.

ECCC operates aerological observing stations throughout Canada, including the Whitehorse Upper Air Station. The station conducts twice-daily upper-air soundings, releasing a gas-filled balloon with an attached instrument that transmits meteorological data to the Canadian Meteorological Center. The data includes temperature, humidity, wind shear, and the height of standard atmospheric pressure levels, which are used in atmospheric modeling for forecasting and global weather monitoring.

The successful bidder will be responsible for conducting the aerological observations using the Vaisala AUTOSONDE AS41, which provides full automation of the upper air observations.

The tender is solicited through a competitive open bidding process. The evaluation criteria will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

**Please note that this tender is now expired.**

To obtain the tender documents, please visit the [.procurement website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/).
